description: Erection of ground floor rear and side single storey extension and replacement of rear window at upper ground floor level.
decision_conditions: <p><span style="font-size: 14px;">The proposed replacement window by virtue of its design would appear as an incongruous addition to the host building which would fail to respect the fenestration hierarchy of the building. The proposal would therefore be contrary to Policy D4 (Delivering Good Design) of the London Plan (2021) and Policy LP1 (</span><font face="Arial"><span style="font-size: 14px; white-space: pre-wrap;">Design, Quality and Local Character) of the Hackney Local Plan LP33 (2020).</span></font></p><div><span style="background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap;"><br></span></div>

The proposed ground floor rear extension, by reason of its height. length and resulting scale along the boundary with No.73 would have a detrimental impact on these neighbouring occupiers due to a loss of light and outlook together with an increased sense of enclosure and appearing overbearing.&nbsp; As such the proposed development is contrary to policies D1 (Londonâ€™s form, character and capacity for growth) and D6 (Housing quality and standards) of the London Plan (2021), policy LP2 (Development and amenity) of the Hackney Local Plan (2020).

The proposed ground floor rear extension, by reason of its siting, detailed design, height, depth and resulting scale is considered to comprise an incongruous addition that would result in unacceptable harm to the character and appearance of the subject property and the surrounding terrace. As such, the proposed development is contrary to policies D3 (Optimising site capacity through the design-led approach) and D4 (Delivering Good Design) of the London Plan (2021), policies LP1 (Design Quality and Local Character) of the Hackney Local Plan (2020) and the guidance contained within Hackney Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2009.
